text: <@U012W4YEUTX> That's it buddy, I need to know if you have any budget endpoints that give me more detailed data. I'm making an appointment at the endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/quotes> and it returns me just that, i need more informations.

Like said on the documentation <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/quotes>

Add a properties parameter in your request.
Does the CRM API allow access to calculated historical data? I would like to see the history of a calculated score property that I created today but over the last 6 months.

is there any possibility to get access to endpoint `/signals/v2/clients/app/eventtracking/slug` by using hapikey? It would be really usefull to have endpoint that let us generate tracking email code, especially when we are using external service like Amazon SES to send emails.

Is it true, that a Enterprise Version is required to trigger Web-Hooks? Even with the API? 
Ref. Documentation: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/de/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows>
Thanks, I was able to use the api key to do a basic query to get started.

As a follow-up (in case anyone else has this issue), domain filtering will apply to the events api as well, so if you blacklist a domain from tracking (in our case hsforms domains, as those would only be used for testing), it will not show up in the events API V3.
correct, either marketing, sales, or service enterprise

There is a way to sort of do this. Instead of adding tracking code, HubSpot handles the send of the entire email via the Transactional Email Module. It's an additional cost to do it (used to be $1000 ($500 for dedicated API and $500 for transactional emails), but I can't find any pricing on the module anymore). Once you have the Transactional Email Module, you can follow these docs to add SMTP tracking to any ESP

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails>

Since this endpoint exists, I'm not sure if there would be a plan to allow for tracking to be added only with the send still happening from a 3rd party ESP.

Hi all,
Does somebody know how can I get the contact schema my app has, to use in the API and create contacts with that exact model?
